column3: You shouldn't relay transactions either. Anyhow, we already skip the script checking up to the last checkpoint, so I don't know this is going to do any good.\n

This would break a fundamental value of bitcoin-core: validation. If you build a farm of bitcoin-nodes, this might be helpful. But i think pulling this into master would enforce centralization. NACK territory IMO.\n

lure-jr: the flag just affects block acceptance, not mem-pool. Are you sure,that this is skipped up to last checkpoint? It doesn't correspond to my observation. Anyway, the process is slowest at the tail. (on $10 virtual on Vultr  one block takes more then 1 minute)\n
I have better idea. To define custom checkpoints from the command line. It would be safer solution.\n
Or even faster and safer: copy the data directory of another node you control.\n
sipa not always. Reindex is always slow\n
Copying the data directory of another node does not require reindexing.\n

To move XX gigabytes accross network is not always without problems. It is faster to copy a few numbers and let the magic flow.

OK, I will no longer bother you.

Yes, perfectly possible with -prune too. If you copy the entire database, the copy is already validated. You should only do this if you trust the machine you're copying from, but there is no overhead.\n
